name: Iced Americano
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the espresso over the ice.
Add cold water to taste.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Latte
Instruction: Brew a single shot of espresso.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the espresso over the ice.
Add cold milk and stir.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Mocha
Instruction: Brew a single shot of espresso.
Mix the chocolate syrup with the espresso.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the chocolate-espresso mix over the ice.
Add cold milk and stir.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Caramal Macchiato
Instruction: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour cold milk over the ice, filling the glass about three-quarters full.
Drizzle caramel sauce around the inside of the glass.
Brew a shot of espresso and pour it gently over the milk and ice.
Drizzle more caramel sauce on top if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Mocha Maddness
Instruction: Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour cold milk over the ice, filling the glass about three-quarters full.
Add 15ml of chocolate syrup and 15ml of caramel syrup to the milk and stir gently.
Brew 60ml of espresso and pour it over the milk and ice.
Top with whipped cream and drizzle more chocolate and caramel syrup on top if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Cappuccino
Instruction: Brew a single shot of espresso.
Fill a glass with ice cubes.
Pour the espresso over the ice.
Add cold milk.
Top with milk foam.
Serve immediately.

name: Ice Blender Oreo Frappe
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso and let it cool.
In a blender, add the cold milk, Oreo cookies, chocolate syrup, ice cubes, and the cooled espresso.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with crushed Oreos.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Blended Coffee Frappe
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso and let it cool.
In a blender, add the cold milk, sugar, ice cubes, chocolate syrup (if using), and the cooled espresso.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with chocolate shavings (if using).
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Blended Mocha Frappe
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso and let it cool.
In a blender, add the cold milk, sugar, cocoa powder, ice cubes, chocolate syrup, and the cooled espresso.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with chocolate shavings.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Blended Choco-Mint Frappe
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso and let it cool.
In a blender, add the cold milk, sugar, cocoa powder, ice cubes, chocolate syrup, mint extract, and the cooled espresso.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with chocolate shavings and fresh mint leaves (if using).
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Blended Strawberry Frappe
Instruction: Brew a double shot of espresso and let it cool.
In a blender, add the cold milk, sugar, fresh strawberries, ice cubes, strawberry syrup, and the cooled espresso.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour the mixture into a tall glass.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with fresh strawberry slices.
Serve immediately.

name: Iced Tea
Instruction: Boil the water in a pot.
Remove the pot from heat and add the tea bags.
Let the tea steep for about 5-7 minutes.
Remove the tea bags and stir in the sugar if desired.
Let the tea cool to room temperature.
Fill a pitcher with ice cubes and pour the cooled tea over the ice.
Add lemon slices to the pitcher.
Garnish with fresh mint leaves if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Mint Lemonade
Ideal Shot: 1 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice (about 4-6 lemons)
Instruction: In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup of water and the sugar.
Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring until the sugar is completely dissolved to make a simple syrup.
Remove the saucepan from heat and let the simple syrup cool to room temperature.
In a large pitcher, combine the freshly squeezed lemon juice and the simple syrup.
Add the remaining 4 cups of cold water and stir well.
Lightly bruise the fresh mint leaves to release their flavor, then add them to the pitcher.
Stir the mint leaves into the lemonade and let it sit for about 10 minutes to infuse the mint flavor.
Fill glasses with ice cubes and pour the mint lemonade over the ice.
Garnish with lemon slices and additional mint leaves.
Serve immediately.
